column4: hey, i installed ubuntu 8.10 and it won't list windows xp from the boot menu... how do I get it back?
brandon - windows xp was at /dev/sda5, i installed linux on /dev/sda6
i can still access my windows partition but I can't boot it
can you pastebin your /boot/grub/menu.lst and sudo fdisk -l please
you want me to post it in the channel
no in pastebin please
okay i pastebin'd http://paste.ubuntu.com/68727/
great, moment please :)
you still there?
yea
any luck with it?
great, can you add these lines to the bottom of your /boot/grub/menu.list
sorry /menu.lst
sorry, add the lines listed here http://paste.ubuntu.com/68732/
add which lines?
I think I tried that and it said invalid device
did you have this line root (hd0,1) the same
I had root (hd0,0) and it said invalid, so i tried editing it a few times
I believe it should be either (hd0.1) or (hd0,2) please try it again
hd0,0 says invalid device, hd0,1 / 2 / 3 says no such partition 4,5,6 says invalid device
hmm thats odd
I think it has something to do with the fact that windows was installed on the extended partition or something
not sure then sorry
